description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Strasbourg" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Strasbourg

places.generalDescription: Parc de l'Orangerie is a charming park located in Strasbourg, dating back to the 17th century. Situated near the European Parliament and the Court of Human Rights, it boasts a rich history that dates back to the French Revolution. Originally home to 140 orange trees confiscated from Chateau de Bouxwiller, only three of these trees remain today and can be seen in the park's greenhouses on certain days.

sources.snippet: Parc de l‚ÄôOrangerie is the perfect escape for couples seeking a romantic retreat amidst nature. Stretching over 26 hectares, this park is known as the ‚Äúgreen lung‚Äù of Strasbourg and offers a peaceful oasis away from the bustling city. As you stroll hand in hand along its winding pathways, you will encounter picturesque gardens, blooming flowers, and a serene lake where you can rent a rowboat and enjoy a romantic ride.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Strasbourg: Ideal Spots for Couples

sources.snippet: In winter, the cold of Alsace is just another reason for lovers to huddle together, especially when it comes to walking. Arm in arm, venture into Strasbourg‚Äôs vast Jardin de l‚ÄôOrangerie (External link) , a classified monument historique, which blends the classical with the romantic. Watch the storks, which have found a haven of peace here since their reintroduction.
sources.shortName: 48 hours in romantic Strasbourg, Alsace

sources.snippet: Venture hand in hand into Strasbourg‚Äôs vast Jardin de l‚ÄôOrangerie, a classified historic monumet, which blends the classical with the romantic. Watch the storks, which have found refuge here since their reintroduction to the city. Take a romantic canoe ride and get up close to the large waterfall in the lake.
sources.shortName: 48 hours in romantic Strasbourg, Alsace

sources.snippet: Pack a bag and have a lunchtime picnic in the city‚Äôs oldest park, Parc de l‚ÄôOrangerie, located in the European Quarter. If you‚Äôre closer to the Mus√©e de l‚ÄôOeuvre Notre-Dam, Jardinet Gothique provides an equally charming setting.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Strasbourg
‚Äã‚ÄãAn Insider‚Äôs Guide to Romantic Strasbourg

places.name: Parc de l'Orangerie

reviews.text:
A lovely park and formal gardens. Great to wander about and do bird spotting. Check out the huge nests on the building's chimneys!
Just a short walk from EU parliament which makes it a great stopping point before walking down road to catch no.2 bus back towards the central station.

The park is beautiful and peaceful. There is a nice lake with ducks and a small white temple that looks very pretty. The grass is green and there are many trees for shade. It is a great place for a walk, a picnic, or to relax. The atmosphere is calm, and it is perfect for sunny days.

A very nice park, beautiful flower arrangements and animals. The stork‚Äòs are impressive and not only around their nest .
A nice waterfall and if you have time rent a boat
We will come back

places.generalDescription: The Cath√©drale Notre-Dame-de-Strasbourg is a stunning Gothic edifice that dates back to the 1200s and features a remarkable 16th-century astronomical clock and a beautiful rose window. Its iconic 142-meter spire can be seen towering over the city's rooftops, making it an unmissable landmark.

sources.snippet: The famous Cathedral Notre-Dame de Strasbourg also merits a visit. Head inside this Gothic masterpiece to admire its majestic astronomical clock dating back to 1547 which presents a daily show at 12:30. Strasbourg‚Äôs oldest park, the 64-acre Parc de l‚ÄôOrangerie offers a bucolic date with nature.
sources.shortName: ‚Äã‚ÄãAn Insider‚Äôs Guide to Romantic Strasbourg

sources.snippet: Within a small area, you will find Notre-Dame Cathedral, Place Gutenberg, Place Kl√©ber, Kammerzell House and the Palais Rohan. All are must-sees in Strasbourg.
sources.shortName: A romantic weekend in Strasbourg

sources.snippet: A view overlooking the Strasbourg Notre-Dame Cathedral‚Äôs roof, with the city stretching beyond it, taken from the staircase to and from the cathedral‚Äôs spire.
sources.shortName: My Recommendations for a Strasbourg Vacation

places.name: Cath√©drale Notre-Dame-de-Strasbourg

reviews.text:
Visiting the Strasbourg Cathedral was an unforgettable highlight of my trip. Awe-inspiring structure is one of the most magnificent examples of Gothic architecture in Europe I guess.

The level of craftsmanship in every inch of the cathedral is truly unbelievable. Each carving, statue, and relief on its seems to carry deep meaning and historical richness. It's not just decorative-it tells stories. You can spend hours simply admiring the exterior, discovering new details every time you look up: scenes from the Bible, mythical creatures, saints, and symbolic motifs, all sculpted with stunning precision.

Stepping inside is just as moving. The vast interior, stained-glass windows is just amazing. You can differentiate based on the art the era it was completed in given it took 500 years on an average to complete it. One of the highlights is the astronomical clock.

If you're anywhere near Alsace, this cathedral is absolutely worth a detour. Magnificent is the only word that even comes close.

The Notre-Dame Cathedral in Strasbourg is beautiful and fascinating, I was in love and amazed by every detail, inside and out.

Climbing the tower by stairs is quite a workout, but it's totally worth it! The view of the city from up there is splendid!

The details and the grandeur inside the cathedral are breathtaking, I was enchanted by the stained glass windows. It was a special visit! ‚ú®

We came for the Luminous exhibition in the evening. It was very beautiful, colorful and joyful with the show and the music in the background also was so beautiful.
If you come for the show better come at least 20 minutes early to pick up the good seat.
Totally recommend the show !

places.address: Pl. de la Cath√©drale, 67000 Strasbourg, France

places.generalDescription: Le Banquet des Sophistes is a contemporary restaurant in Reims, France that offers refined, seasonal French classics and tasting menus. Chef Nicolas Koffel takes an unfussy approach to modern cuisine with a locally-leaning wine list. The menu changes regularly and features about three choices for starters, mains, and desserts, as well as a tasting menu option.

sources.snippet: Le Banquet des Sophistes is a bistronomic restaurant, that is to say mixing ‚Äúthe refinement of gastronomic dishes with the conviviality of a bistro‚Äù. It is located in the city center of Strasbourg, at the very beginning of the Krutenau district, a few steps away from the Grande Ile. I had a real crush on this very pleasant place, where you are really well received and where you can taste dishes with original flavors.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: Le Banquet des Sophistes

reviews.text: This is a cozy and charming restaurant. We had a late lunch today and the food was fantastic. For lunch, they had two starter choices, three plats, and two desserts. ‚Ç¨26 for each person. You could also order starter/plat or plat/dessert for a smaller price. Server was very friendly, highly recommend this place.

Magnificent.

A small menu because they know how to make an outstanding meal in a well decorated and bright bistro interior.

There's not much to say besides it was one of the best meals I tried during my week in France and the best meal I've had in ages.

It was fresh, elegant, and fairly priced. Staff was friendly and could explain in multiple languages the details on the menu- showing the great care des Sophistes puts into every last detail of the dining experience.

A must-visit of Strasbourg.

Great food, just one small minus that the broccoli was burnt black on the side. They changed it but still another piece was black too. The rest tasted great, nice decoration of food and seating. Extremely friendly service. I went there for lunch. 21‚Ç¨ for the soup and the main was worth it. You should definitely book the seats otherwise no chance here.

places.generalDescription: Blue Flamingo offers a unique dining experience aboard a floating restaurant with a chic and exotic atmosphere. The menu is constantly refreshed every three weeks, offering a selection of starters, main courses, and desserts to cater to various dietary preferences. The restaurant prides itself on serving homemade dishes made with fresh ingredients, including options for gluten-free diets. Guests can enjoy stunning views of the river while savoring delicious meals and excellent wine pairings recommended by the attentive staff.

sources.snippet: This restaurant, located on a boat in front of Riv√©toile district, offers an original view on the city. We disconnect and enjoy. The menu is relatively short and made with good fresh products.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway in Strasbourg : 10 activities to do as a couple

places.name: Blue Flamingo

reviews.text: The Blue Flamingo is an absolute culinary delight. Everything from the service, atmosphere, and most importantly the food is top class. I appreciate the attention to detail and the kindness that our waiter had throughout the entire night and left here with not only a full, satisfied stomach but fullness in my heart.

Because of this restaurant I am in love with french cuisine. Thanks for the beautifully made dishes. Lunch menu is simple which saves me a lot of time deciding what to eat. It's my first time trying french cuisine in a restaurant that is super.

The food was good, although I don't really understand why the restaurant is included in the Michelin Guide. The cloth napkins were rather small and felt synthetic, not very pleasant to use. There was also no variety of glasses for champagne, which was a bit surprising, but acceptable. The main disappointment, however, was that the ashtray outside is placed right next to the entrance, so smoke drifts inside the restaurant. It would be such an easy fix to move it a little further away, allowing guests to enjoy their meal without being disturbed.

places.generalDescription: Taaka Beer Spa in Strasbourg offers a unique and exclusive experience for those looking to try something new. The spa embraces the culture of the Alsace region, offering a one-hour session divided into sauna, beer bath, and relaxation room. Guests can enjoy the quirky pleasure of bathing in malt, hops, and beer yeast while indulging in delicious beer and food options. The friendly staff ensures a relaxing and enjoyable experience for visitors, making it an ideal place to unwind with friends or loved ones.

sources.snippet: For an experience that combines relaxation and the unusual, head for the Taaka Beer Spa, in the heart of Strasbourg. We often don't realise it, but beer hops, malt and yeast have a number of benefits for the skin!. To make the most of them, Taaka Beer Spa offers a three-stage treatment:
sources.shortName: What to do in Strasbourg as a romantic getaway

places.name: Taaka Beer Spa

reviews.text:
A Unique and Relaxing Experience
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I had an amazing time at Taaka Beer Spa! The experience starts with a rejuvenating sauna, followed by a beer bath that leaves you feeling incredibly relaxed. The combination of warmth and the soothing beer-infused water was surprisingly refreshing.

The snacks, though not included, were a nice touch, adding to the overall enjoyment. The atmosphere was peaceful and the staff was friendly, making it a perfect escape for anyone looking to unwind. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a unique and relaxing spa day!

Just went here for my birthday today and it was a wonderful experience. I had been looking for something unique to do for the day and this knocked it out of the park. Would highly recommend to do if you need some time to relax while in the area.

We had a really nice time at Taaka Beer Spa. The bathtub with beer ingredients while enjoying fresh beer was a very particular and enjoyable spa experience. Also, the personnel was very kind, making us feel welcome and comfortable and explaining every step. We highly recommend it.

places.generalDescription: Place Kl√©ber is Strasbourg's main square, offering a spacious pedestrian area lined with shops and cafes. The square hosts the famous Christkindelsmarik de Strasbourg Christmas market, featuring an impressive fir tree that marks the beginning of the festive season. This market is part of eleven markets spread across central Strasbourg, each with its own specialties but all offering ornaments, gifts, pottery, linens, foods, mulled wine, and the city's symbolic storks.

sources.snippet: Another very famous Square, if not the most important, is Strasbourg‚Äòs main public square in Grande √éle: Kleber Square. It‚Äôs the meeting place for Strasburgers at major cultural or sporting events as well as the place where you can admire the huge Christmas tree during Christmas time. Around the square there is a pink sandstone building dating from 1770, the Aubette.
sources.shortName: Visit Strasbourg: TOP 25 Things to Do and Must See

sources.snippet: Within a small area, you will find Notre-Dame Cathedral, Place Gutenberg, Place Kl√©ber, Kammerzell House and the Palais Rohan. All are must-sees in Strasbourg.
sources.shortName: A romantic weekend in Strasbourg
‚Äã‚ÄãAn Insider‚Äôs Guide to Romantic Strasbourg

places.name: Place Kl√©ber

reviews.text: Such a beautiful part of Strasbourg worth a visit! I visited during the Spring. Beautiful floral blossoms were everywhere, the buildings are historic & stunning & so many adorable shops! I enjoyed exploring around taking photographs of the charming area & shopping.

Christmas here is very festive. It is very crowded with people coming from all over the world. But the holiday/christmas feeling is still there. I think people are just minding their own business, each wanting to enjoy their own holiday, no nuisances.

With the Xmas market in full throttle, hard to get around but perfect atmosphere for any festive market. I hope the tradition continues for ages. We stayed on in an apartment opening to the square for a wholesome experience but found that our stairs to the parking lot was the universal toilet for emergencies.

places.generalDescription: The Strasbourg Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art is a striking glass-fronted museum showcasing modern art, photography, and installations. Situated near the Covered Bridges, it offers an expansive collection spanning from Impressionism to contemporary works. Visitors can admire pieces by renowned artists such as Monet, Picasso, Klee, and Rodin. The museum's temporary exhibitions add further depth to its offerings. Additionally, the terrace cafe provides a delightful dining option with picturesque views.

sources.snippet: Modern and Contemporary Art Museum: The Strasbourg Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art has a so-so permanent collection, though the temporary expositions, of which the museum has several always underway, make a visit well worth the trip. (And the museum‚Äôs caf√© is a delicious option for lunch!) We saw several fun, insightful, and thought-provoking pieces that I returned to more than once during our visit, to see them ‚Äúone more time before we go.‚Äù One example: The animatronic spider by Alain S√©chas, L‚ÄôAraign√©e Les Riches, le retour, which I captured on video during out visit (video below!).
sources.shortName: My Recommendations for a Strasbourg Vacation

sources.snippet: Meanwhile, the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art boasts the works of world-renowned artists including Gustave Dor√© and Jean Arp, two leading figures from Strasbourg. The famous Cathedral Notre-Dame de Strasbourg also merits a visit. Head inside this Gothic masterpiece to admire its majestic astronomical clock dating back to 1547 which presents a daily show at 12:30.
sources.shortName: ‚Äã‚ÄãAn Insider‚Äôs Guide to Romantic Strasbourg

sources.snippet: As long as you are in the Petite France district, take advantage of this opportunity to visit Strasbourg Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (‚Äúmus√©e d‚Äôart moderne et contemporain de Strasbourg‚Äù). It‚Äôs locateds not far from the Vauban Dam. Pieces of art by Monet, Picasso and Brauner can be seen.
sources.shortName: Visit Strasbourg: TOP 25 Things to Do and Must See

places.name: Strasbourg Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art

reviews.text: It was a really nice museum. The price was very reasonable. The staff was friendly and the museum had interesting art displayed. Be aware of the opening hours, besides that great!

Great museum with a fantastic collection of modern art. Very nice presentation that includes impressionist art. The check-in is very convenient, with tickets at  euro 7.50 per person. I went in the morning after they opened. Highly recommend this museum!

Beautiful place, the design of the museum it's an art work of the minimalism. The museum it's small but it have great works of local and international artist. The entrance of the museum have one of the most gorgeous murals that I have ever seen. A must if you have the opportunity to go to Strasbourg.

places.generalDescription: Grande-√éle de Strasbourg, located in the heart of the city, is a renowned historical center and the first to be entirely classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This island is home to an array of attractions including churches, palaces, hotels, and shops. The city itself boasts a population of nearly half a million people and spans across the river into Germany.

sources.snippet: As such, it‚Äôs made up of several islands, but the best known is the Grande √éle (‚ÄúLarge Island‚Äù in French), which has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1988. It‚Äôs the historical centre of the city and the place where you can admire the main monuments and points of interest that make Strasbourg famous. The world renowned Strasbourg cathedral (cath√©drale Notre-Dame de Strasbourg in French), 4 medieval churches, as well as several hotels and palaces from the 18th century are located there.
sources.shortName: Visit Strasbourg: TOP 25 Things to Do and Must See

sources.snippet: The historic heart of the city, the Grande √éle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Grande √éle is very representative of what a medieval city was. Within a small area, you will find Notre-Dame Cathedral, Place Gutenberg, Place Kl√©ber, Kammerzell House and the Palais Rohan.
sources.shortName: A romantic weekend in Strasbourg

places.name: Grande-√éle de Strasbourg

reviews.text: An island located in Strasbourg.It has it's simbolical houses which are beautiful.The river Ill is also stunning and it is a must go in Strasbourg.
We have been there in December and it was such a nice experience, with all the beautiful christmas decorations it looked so cute. Really nice.
Amazing night show, beauty! Can't beat German buildings in France.

places.generalDescription: The Bistrot Coco is a modern and elegant restaurant with a rotating lineup of creative takes on French cuisine. The food is unique and incorporates different flavours from varied inspirations. The chefs are known for their refined and daring cuisine, which focuses on using game, fruit, and vegetable dishes.

sources.snippet: The Bistrot Coco is one of my favorite restaurants in Strasbourg. It is located in the heart of downtown, on the big island. I‚Äôve been there several times and have always come away enchanted.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: Bistrot Coco

reviews.text: Worthy of a Michelin star! We had the 5-course surprise dinner menu and were satisfied with all of them. Cozy interior and friendly service.  We're happy that we could bring our small dog to the restaurant. If I must give an improvement point, the bread was average and could be better. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.
Had the 5 course tasting menu and the infused vodka cocktail. Both excellent, especially the cocktail.

Extraordinary experience in Bistrot Coco ü´∂üèª We chose the 6 course menu and the 4 wines to go with it. The food was incredible, you could really tell that each dish was thought through and created taking into account every detail and to create an amazing flavor experience. The sweet bread and also the pre dessert with safran ice cream were my favorites!! Looking forward to the next time ‚ò∫Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: La Corde √† Linge is a popular restaurant located in the heart of La Petite France in Strasbourg. Despite its touristy appearance, locals appreciate its large waterfront terrace and traditional Alsatian dishes such as spatzle. The restaurant offers a solid menu featuring Alsatian, French, and Continental cuisine. With a charming setting and the option to dine al fresco by the river Ill, it's an ideal spot for lunch or dinner while exploring Strasbourg.

sources.snippet: La Corde √† Linge, is this restaurant which the Strasbourgeois will say to you that it is very tourist but where they will rush as soon as the beautiful days arrive. La Corde √† Linge has one of the most beautiful terraces in Strasbourg, located on the waterfront in the heart of the Petite France district. Really nice for lunch, dinner or a drink!
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: La Corde √† Linge

reviews.text: I just had a great lunch experience here. The Alsatian pasta, Picon beer and the dessert were just delicious! What made my experience better is the really friendly waiter, Jerome. French waiters aren't known to be really friendly with great service, but Jerome changed that typical 'reputation' of French restaurant service. üòä He's awesome!

Recently went there on my vacation in Strasbourg. No complains whatsoever. The service is entertaining and puts effort into learning different languages for the tourists. Food is perfect, I wish I could eat there weekly. I recommend going there at around 9-10 pm. It won't be full like in the afternoon. It will be a comfortable atmosphere with a view on the river, nice service and really delicious food. Definitely recommend the Spaetzle, which basically everyone had on their plate, and definitely recommend the restaurant.

Lucky enough to be passing on a Tuesday 13.30 pm . Straight on a lovely table in the shade of a large tree. Food was very good, pork with seasonal vegetables in sauce..see picture. Staff super friendly and helpful. Very good value for such a delicious meal. We tried to return that same evening but the wait to be seated queue was very long..though probably wish we had joined it :)

places.generalDescription: La Casserole is a charming gastronomic restaurant situated in the heart of downtown Strasbourg, near the Notre-Dame cathedral. The restaurant offers artfully presented traditional French dishes in a contemporary and elegant dining room, creating an intimate atmosphere for guests to enjoy their meals. The menu features modern cuisine with a focus on Alsatian specialties, providing visitors with a delightful culinary experience.

sources.snippet: Among many places not to be missed, La Casserole welcomes you near the Notre-Dame cathedral in Strasbourg in a cocooning atmosphere unless you succumb to one of the pastries of the hotel Leonor. Why not let yourself be tempted by a coco-exotic dessert accompanied by a hot chocolate or a Mariage Fr√®res tea?. Leonor Restaurant and Tearoom Restaurant La Casserole Tasting Alsatian specialities in a winstub
sources.shortName: 48 hours in romantic Strasbourg, Alsace

sources.snippet: The restaurant La Casserole is a gastronomic restaurant located in the heart of downtown Strasbourg. With its small room giving the place an intimate atmosphere and its sober and elegant decoration, La Casserole is a real little jewel where it is very pleasant to spend a moment to enjoy a meal. On the kitchen side, the level is also very high.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)
What to do in Strasbourg as a romantic getaway

places.name: La Casserole

reviews.text:
I recently had a wonderful lunch experience at La Casserole in Strasbourg, where we indulged in a delightful three-course meal. From the moment we entered, the discreetly elegant interior set the tone for a memorable dining experience. The warm ambiance, complemented by comfortable yet colorful chairs and thoughtfully arranged tables, created an intimate setting that made us feel right at home.

The friendly and attentive staff were exceptional throughout our visit, ensuring that our needs were met without being intrusive. Their knowledge of the menu added to the fine dining experience, as they guided us through the various options with enthusiasm.

Each course was a testament to the restaurant's commitment to quality and creativity. The flavors were beautifully balanced, showcasing fresh, local ingredients that elevated our meal. The attention to detail in both the presentation and taste truly exemplified what fine dining should be.
Overall, La Casserole not only delivered a fantastic culinary experience but also provided an inviting atmosphere that made our lunch truly special. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an exquisite meal in Strasbourg!

Incredible ambiance, elegant + tastful interior.  Very mediocre service, perhaps because we did not speak French, noticed other patrons who all spoke French had much more attentive service.  Waited nearly 30 minutes after finishing main courses for plates to be cleared. entrees decent(ouef & lobster), main courses(veal & pheasant) dry chewy & not much flavor. 3 hours for 3 courses. Wonderful selection of wine.

This restaurant does not have a Michelin star but certainly deserves it. We ate a menu with matching wines. A sensation for your tongue. Really insanely good food. We were alone all evening and the bill was definitely high but I wouldn't have missed it.

places.generalDescription: Nestled beneath the Strasbourg Hospital, the Cave Historique des Hospices de Strasbourg is a remarkable landmark that dates back to 1395. This historic cellar offers visitors an enchanting glimpse into the past, showcasing a collection of around 60 majestic oak barrels filled with exquisite Alsatian wines. The unique origin of these wines stems from a time when patients would pay for their medical care with land and vineyards, making wine not just a beverage but also an essential part of both religious and medicinal practices.

sources.snippet: Dating back to the Middle Ages, this place was probably created to store the bottles of wine offered as payment for treatment. Since 1995, they have been in use again, storing the delicious Alsatian wines. The cellar of the Hospices Civils de Strasbourg contains the oldest wine in barrels in the world.
sources.shortName: A romantic weekend in Strasbourg

places.name: Cave Historique des Hospices de Strasbourg

reviews.text: Nice place to visit and learn about the history of the hospital cave and winemaking. A must visit for people who enjoy wine. There is a nice collection of wines from local producers to buy and 3 times per year there are organized wine tasting events. The entrance is free of charge and if you want an audio guide there is a small fee of 3 euro per person to rent it.
Self-guided tour with an audio guide for 3‚Ç¨. We didn't inquire about any wine tastings. Interesting history, a short tunnel  to explore, and a comprehensive wine shop representative of the area.

I had a great experience visiting the historic cave  section and the wine cellar.
The entrance is free of charge and there was no queue on a Monday.

Seeing the various wine barrels was very interesting, including the story on the barrel from 1472 which is also displayed.
The wine from 1472 is still kept in a barrel in that cellar!

On a side note, the Hospices building where the cellar is located is really interesting looking and the cellar also offers a cool break from the heat on hot days.

places.generalDescription: Les Sales Gosses is a modern restaurant located on Boulevard Clemenceau. The concept is simple yet creative, with a new menu every 6 weeks that evolves according to the seasons and explores different regions or terroirs each time. Chef Fabrice's cuisine offers Mediterranean, Creole, and Breton influences. The atmosphere is described as simple, modern, and warm. Guests have praised the impeccable service and value for money at this cute French restaurant.

sources.snippet: 6 starters, 6 courses, a menu that changes every 6 weeks on a regional theme and a cuisine based on fresh products only (the restaurant has the label of Master Restaurateur). Exactly what I like!. In terms of atmosphere, the restaurant‚Äôs decoration is modern and the place is pleasant.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: Restaurant Les Sales Gosses √† Strasbourg

reviews.text:
Sadly the only excellent meal I had during the week, but let's celebrate how good this was anyway!

A proper cute French restaurant, impeccable service, and a really good value lunch.

Only two choices for each course, so you'll need not to be fussy.  The ratatouille with goats cheese was superb, the salmon perfectly cooked, the sauce with the salmon really good, and artichokes nicely balanced.

Loved, loved, loved this restaurant and if I ever come back to Strasbourg, I will go again.  Merci!

Nice atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, but, on that specific evening, I wasn't fully pleased with the tastes.  Perhaps, it had to do with the dishes I chose from the current menu, which eventually didn't prove to be to my liking. This wouldn't prevent me from going back tho, as I know the restaurant changes the menu catalog frequently.
This restaurant is wonderful, I visited with my family for my sons birthday. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly.

places.generalDescription: Buerehiesel is a renowned restaurant located in a reconstructed 1800s farmhouse within the Orangerie park. The charming timbered house features a glass conservatory and offers an exquisite dining experience. Chef Eric Westermann showcases the freshest local specialties and seafood from Brittany, presenting dishes like free-range Alsace chicken with Vosges truffles and saut√©ed frog legs served with schniederspaetle.

sources.shortName: 48 hours in romantic Strasbourg, Alsace
48 hours in romantic Strasbourg, Alsace

places.name: Buerehiesel

reviews.text:
We enjoyed a very relaxed meal here. Buerehiesel boast of a lovely setting, with a beautiful conservatory in the park. The menu was well presented and had a variety of classic and modern French dishes. The wine menu was extensive and complimented the food well.

The dishes were beautifully presented and we enjoyed the frogs legs and the starters the most. The veal was slightly tough unfortunately. However the other dishes we tried were very well cooked and had great flavours.

The service wasn't very attentive, and we had extremely long periods between courses. Fortunately, we weren't time pressured, so this wasn't as much of an issue as it could have been.

I would definitely like to revisit and see what other delicious dishes Buerehiesel have to offer.

Lunch (menu d'affaires). Have wanted to visit for some time and was not disappointed. Excellent food and wine pairing, beautiful setting and staff who went above and beyond to welcome and accommodate us. Thank you for a lovely experience!

9/10 for the Rouget dish with vengole. 10/10 for the veal Lacaune dish with artichokes pur√©e. Also 10/10 for the souffl√© dessert ‚Äúsouffl√© chaud √† la p√™che blanche et sorbet au thym‚Äù. 7/10 for the mille-feuille au chocolat with sorbet chocolate. Lacks freshness. However 10/10 for the starters savory Kugelhopf and micro flammkuchen. So kind careful and attentive service. We were here for dinner. It was my first Michelin star restaurant in France. So nice atmosphere outdoor on an evening of 32 degree summer day surrounded by the nice typical Alsatian architecture and the green all around.  The Buerehiesel is an Alsatian house dating from 1607. Around 10 tables of 3 and 5 outdoor under lovely sunshades. Very romantic atmosphere. For the record, the building was brought piece by piece to the park on the occasion of the International Industrial Exhibition of 1895. Her vegetable garden and gazebo came with her. This year marks the year when Strasbourg hosted the international event in the Orangerie Park.

Pity it was too gloomy at the tables on the terrace. If you want to see what is on your plate and the nice colors of the dishes and the desserts prefer to book a table inside. Lovely and luminous inside.

places.generalDescription: Fink Stuebel is an authentic Alsatian restaurant and guesthouse situated just outside the Petite France district in Strasbourg. The rustic half-timbered house offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, complete with traditional regional furniture and painted ceilings. The a la carte menu boasts a wide selection of Alsatian dishes, including foie gras, escargots, sausages, and sauerkraut served generously.

sources.snippet: The Fink Stuebel is a restaurant and guesthouse located right on the edge of the Petite France district. It is a good winstub to taste traditional Alsatian cuisine in a traditional decor: half-timbering, painted ceiling, checkered tablecloths and regional furniture put you directly in the atmosphere. On the menu, a wide choice of Alsatian dishes served generously, some of which are more original than what you can usually find.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: Fink Stuebel

reviews.text:
Amazing place. Feels as if one was in the
Medieval years. Great atmosphere amd service and fantastic food. Don't miss out on the ragout!!
Excellent, hearty local food! Really good portions and excellent value. Highly recommended! Also recommend picking up a Picon biere.

Finkstuebel in Strasbourg is a gem for traditional Alsatian food. The cozy, rustic vibe adds to the charm, making it feel like a true local experience. The food was excellent-authentic, flavorful, and well-prepared. The staff was friendly, though a bit confusing at times, but it didn't take away from the experience. Perfect spot if you're looking to enjoy local cuisine in a welcoming atmosphere!

places.generalDescription: Le Tire-Bouchon is a renowned restaurant in Strasbourg, known for its charming exterior adorned with teddy bears, colorful ornaments, and pine garlands. This relaxed eatery offers a generous fixed-price and a la carte menu options, as well as a terrace for outdoor dining. Situated near the cathedral of Strasbourg, it has been recognized with a Bib Gourmand by the Michelin Guide for its excellent value.

sources.snippet: The Tire-Bouchon is a good winstub located near the cathedral of Strasbourg. It is a Strasbourg institution, where one comes to taste delicious traditional Alsatian cuisine. Sauerkraut, baeckeoffe, braised knuckle of ham, pikeper fillet on a bed of sauerkraut‚Ä¶ The classics of Alsatian gastronomy are represented and very well cooked.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Strasbourg? ü•® My favorite restaurants (2025)

places.name: Le Tire-Bouchon

reviews.text:
We went here for lunch today.
The food was delicious and the service was good. We tried the snails, the pork cheeks, the braised Ham, and Smoked salmon with potatoes. For dessert we tried the creme bruillet. Everything was super delicious.

This restaurant is in close proximity to the Strasbourg Cathedral, and we managed to secure a table for six after being turned away by four other restaurants on Boxing Day.
They have three floors for seating, so you can always check for availability. We opted for the set menu for dinner, which was offered at ‚Ç¨29.90 or ‚Ç¨39.90. The portion is generous.

They serve Alsatian cuisine, and the overall quality is acceptable. One dish we did not enjoy was the salad that came with the set menu. However, other dishes like the fish and pork were satisfactory. The service was a bit slow, but the dessert was well done

Today we visited Strasbourg France. After our canal boat cruise, and walking tour, and upon recommendation from our tour guide, Connie, Dan, Kathy & I had a fabulous Lunch at Le Tire-Bouchon.
We had Chicken Cordon Bleu, Filet Mignon au Pork Tenderloin, Viennese Veal Escalope. Sides were, Fried Potatoes,  Fries & Spaetzle. Everything was absolutely delicious and prepared perfectly! Our great servers were Nassar Hichan & Edward. They took great care of us. We're saving room for Dessert, to enjoy one of the great Gelato Shoppe's in Strasbourg......

places.address: 5 Rue des Tailleurs de Pierre, 67000 Strasbourg, France

places.generalDescription: Nestled behind a burgundy, wooden, and glass door at the foot of Strasbourg Cathedral lies Au Fond du Jardin, an enchanting boutique and tea salon with a Victorian-inspired decor. This elegant and unique establishment offers high-end pastries, including exquisite madeleines, perfect for indulging in during their "gouter" - the French version of British tea time. The ambiance is reminiscent of an English way of life with a focus on artisanal traditions.

sources.snippet: Au fond du Jardin‚Äôs sobritish decor stops time in its tracks, offering the perfect intimacy to enjoy a delicious tea accompanied by their famous madeleines du voyage. On sunny days, you can even enjoy the terrace with its very bucolic setting that almost makes us forget that we are at the foot of the cathedral of Strasbourg.
sources.shortName: What to do in Strasbourg for lovers? ü©∑ 15 romantic places

places.name: Au Fond du Jardin

reviews.text:
We did not manage to make reservations for afternoon tea and queued for about an hour to get into the shop to purchase the madeleines and tea.

The owner was very passionate and explained to us the stories behind the madeleines.  That really helped us enjoy the madeleines on a different level, not only were the madeleines so beautiful, the stories brought us to the next level of enjoyment when we savoured the madeleines.  Our favourites was Coeur de Givre, Jardin √† Marrakech, Magie Pralin√©, and Victoria.

The owner also recommended some tea for us, they are very reasonably priced.  We have not tried yet but are looking forward to taste them soon.
Cutest tea room. Madeleines are to die for. Super helpful staff as well. The interior feels straight out of a story book.

Magical place to be. I love every detail of this place and how the decorations change with the season. Try to reserve online at least one month in advance. Frederick "the owner/creator" is almost always present and welcomes each customer with great elegance and warmth. The other staff is also lovely. Great selection of teas and madeleines as well. Overall, an unforgettable tea time experience ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: 6 Rue de la R√¢pe, 67000 Strasbourg, France

places.generalDescription: AEDAEN PLACE is a multifaceted venue located in rue des Aveugles, offering a fusion of classic French cuisine and modern dishes. The establishment comprises an art gallery, brasserie, cake boudoir, pizza restaurant, and a secret bar. The interior boasts whimsical decor with an indoor jungle theme. The menu features fresh products and changes every three days to offer delightful dishes.

sources.snippet: AEDAEN Place is a special place in Strasbourg, a place with many facets. In front, it is a pleasant brasserie and pizzeria. But it also contains a literary caf√© and a bar-boudoir.
sources.shortName: What to do in Strasbourg for lovers? ü©∑ 15 romantic places

places.name: AEDAEN PLACE

reviews.text:
This is another great Italian discovery for me!  Has a peculiar interior design, tasty meals, good service (after reading comments maybe I was lucky). The location is convenient. The prices are reasonable.
It's a great place for date nights if you wanna impress someone special.

We took the burger and to be honest it was not that impressive at all. On their online platforms it looked very good but when we tried it, the burger was overcooked, and the bread was very thick and dry making the burger in general very dry. The flavour of the meat however was very good and the salad you got on the side was delicious! The staff was very friendly. Don't really think it was worth 22 CHF.

Found this gem for good Italian food by chance. It's located near the Catheral. We had the lunch special Osso Corso Risotto which came with a plate of smoked salmon
Salad. The portion was generous for the amount we paid. The smoked salmon
Salad was extremely tasty and we love the freshly baked artisanal baguette. Requested for extra serving of the baguette which they generously obliged.

The risotto was creamy and cooked to perfection. Can't ask for more. We totally enjoyed the dish. The cream br√ªl√©e was a little sweet for us, custard texture  was just nice

Like the creative decor of the place. And the server was friendly and helpful in explaining what constitutes the special lunch meal. It's a place to go to for Italian food

places.generalDescription: Acad√©mie de la Bi√®re is a must-visit for beer enthusiasts, situated near the Port Royal Observatory. Since the 1960s, this pub has been a haven for Belgian beer lovers, offering an extensive selection of brews, ciders, and liquors from across Europe. The menu is thoughtfully crafted to complement the beverage choices. For a classic experience, patrons can savor Belgian beer paired with fresh mussels and French fries.

sources.snippet: For something more upmarket, consider L‚Äô√©picerie, known for its elegant d√©cor and exhaustive local wine list. Le Bar Champagne is perfect for those who want to celebrate an anniversary with a glass of bubbles, while La Java is known for its late-night party atmosphere.
sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Strasbourg

places.name: Acad√©mie de la Bi√®re

reviews.text: Very friendly service and the waiter recommendation of Flamb√©e was the most delicious one. The tropical beer is delicious, a sweeter beer with a hint of passion fruit.

Good place to eat if you are a beer lover. There are so many flavors it's hard to choose.  The place is really cramped, hardly enough space to pass between tables. We were lucky to find a place to sit even by the window.  You have to order first and pay your tab before you sit on your table. Then your order arrives and enjoy your meal and drink. The Burger was about average and nothing special. Beers are good though we only tried two. Overall it was not what I expected as far as food quality. Nevertheless it's a good experience when you are in Petite France
Not bad. Nice flammekueche and good local beer. The place is warm but could be a bit more friendly. We went at the end of the Christmas season so staff may start being a bit tired.

places.generalDescription: The Mus√©e de l'≈íuvre-Notre-Dame is a captivating museum located at the foot of the Notre Dame Cathedral in Strasbourg. Housed in a remarkable half-medieval, half-Renaissance building, it offers a journey through seven centuries of artistic development in the Upper Rhine region. The museum's collection includes upper-Rhenish art dating back to 1681, featuring sculptures, stained-glass windows, and architectural fragments from Strasbourg Cathedral.

sources.shortName: A couple‚Äôs guide to Strasbourg

places.name: Mus√©e de l'≈íuvre-Notre-Dame

reviews.text: This was one of three museums we visited during our weekend stay in Strasbourg. Such beautiful statues and pieces of art. It's definitely a must visit museum if you decide to come to this city. It's also in the same exhibit as two other really nice museums

Very impressive, not only the church! The museum showcases a remarkable collection of important and fascinating artifacts from around Strasbourg Cathedral, thoughtfully installed throughout the space. It's larger than it seems from the outside, so plan to spend at least 1.5 hours exploring. Several stations also feature interactive instruments you can try out.
One of the most meaningful museums in Strasbourg. The collection is very engaging, especially if you're into religious history. The staff were genuinely kind and attentive!
